thread.title: Cubs beat Pirates in NL Wildcard
thread.title_full: Cubs beat Pirates in NL Wildcard

title: Cubs beat Pirates in NL Wildcard
text:
Cubs beat Pirates in NL Wildcard 
By Eric Dutkiewicz - 21Alive Cubs beat Pirates in NL Wildcard October 8, 2015 Updated Oct 8, 2015 at 12:34 AM EDT 
PITTSBURGH (21Alive) - The Chicago Cubs won their first Major League Baseball playoff game in 12 years Wednesday, beating the Pittsburgh Pirates in a one-game National League Wildcard. 
Cubs pitcher Jake Arrieta threw a complete game shutout in the 4-0 victory. 
Digital Daily â€“ subscribe to our daily newsletter 
The Cubs added a 2-run homerun from Kyle Schwarber and a home run from Dexter Fowler. 
The Pirates, who finished the regular season with 98 wins, managed only 4 hits in front of a record-setting crowd at PNC Park. 
The Cubs advance to the National League Divisional Series against archrival St. Louis. That series starts Friday night. 
The Cubs, in the postseason for the first time in 7 years, had not won a playoff game since Game 4 of the 2003 National League Series against the Florida Marlins.
